narrative.title: 7Th Armoured Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: British Armoured Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Elite mobile armoured division. Primary role Q2 1943: Complete Tunisia Campaign (April-13 May), then rest/refit/retrain for Operation Husky (Sicily invasion, July 1943). Transition from desert warfare to Mediterranean amphibious operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Tunisia coastal region - Mediterranean coast, agricultural plains, hills (Sousse-Sfax rest areas)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Veteran North Africa combat experience (43 months continuous combat by June 1943)
Combined arms mastery (armour, infantry, artillery coordination)
Anti-German tactics (extensive Afrika Korps combat experience)
High morale from Tunisia victory (13 May 1943)

environment.terrain_type: Tunisia coastal region - Mediterranean coast, agricultural plains, hills (Sousse-Sfax rest areas)
